pages.text: And We called him from the right (hand) side of the Mount Toor and drew him nearer for secret talk
And We granted to him from Our mercy, his brother Aaron, a prophet
And mention in the book (about) Ishmael, he was truthful in his promise and he was a messenger, a prophet
And he used to enjoin on his people worship (salat) and charity (zakat) and he was one with whom his Lord was pleased
And mention in the book (about) Enoch, he was a truthful man, a prophet
and We raised him to a high place

Those are the persons on whom God bestowed (His) favour, from among the prophets from the descendants of Adam and from among those whom We carried with Noah (in the ship) and from among the descendants of Abraham and Israel and from among those whom We guided and chose, when the communications of the Beneficent (God) were read to them they fell down prostrating and weeping
But the successors who succeeded after them wasted their worship (salat) and followed lusty desires, so they will meet (the punishment for their) error
except him who repents and believes and does righteous work, so those will enter the garden and they will not be dealt with unjustly in anything
gardens of everlasting bliss which the Beneficent (God) has promised to His servants in the unseen, His promise will certainly come to pass
Therein they will not hear (any) vain talk but peace, and therein there will be their provision for them morning and evening
That is the garden which We will make (those of) Our servants to inherit who had guarded (against evil)
And we do not come down but by the command of your Lord, to Him belongs whatever is before us and whatever is behind us and whatever is between that, and your Lord is not forgetful
